solution.text:
Let the number of extra goals to be scored by each team be \(x\).
Assume that team \(1\) has scored \(_{j}_\) goals and team \(2\) has scored \(_{k}_\) goals.
To qualify for the next round,
\(\frac{_{j}_+x}{_{k}_+x}=\frac23\)
\(\Rightarrow 3(_{j}_)+3x=2(_{k}_)+2x\)
\(\Rightarrow x= _{{(2*k)-(3*j)}}_\)
Therefore, the amount of extra goals to be scored by each team is \(_{{(2*k)-(3*j)}}_\)

content.text: There is a Football League match. The score of the match is _{j}_-_{k}_. To qualify for the next round, both teams have to score the same number of goals such that the score is in the ratio of 2:3. What is the extra number of goals each team has to score?
